A: 1. Peaceful Co-existence means different people living together in _ (a) conflict (b) peace (c) anger
2. When people live together without disagreement, there is peaceful co-existence among _ (a) them (b) us (c) foes
3. Jesus taught us to live _ with others (a) angrily (b) peacefully (c) selfishly
4. If someone offends us, Jesus advised us to _ the person (a) punish (b) ignore (c) forgive
5. God wants us to live peacefully with others in the _ (a) house (b) community (c) forest
6. In the Bible, there are good examples of people who lived happily together to prevent _ (a) joy (b) disagreement (c) sleep
7. Esau and Jacob reconciled after Jacob took the _ of Esau (a) food (b) blessings (c) money
8. Abraham prevented a quarrel between him and his nephew, _ (a) Saul (b) David (c) Lot
9. It is good to show _ to others (a) anger (b) love (c) fear
10. Jesus wants us to show love and _ to people (a) hatred (b) hospitality (c) sadness
11. We should tell people the _ (a) lies (b) truth (c) stories
12. We should be _-minded to people (a) closed (b) narrow (c) open
13. Jonathan and David showed _ love to each other (a) selfish (b) unselfish (c) little
14. Jonathan loved David as his own _ (a) enemy (b) soul (c) pet
15. King Saul was Jonathan's _ (a) brother (b) father (c) friend
16. Jonathan saved David by telling him the plans of _ (a) Saul (b) Goliath (c) Samuel
17. Jonathan and David made a _ (a) promise (b) covenant (c) secret
18. Pupils should show love to _ another (a) no (b) one (c) only some
19. We should share our _ with others (a) secrets (b) belongings (c) worries
20. We should protect one another when there is _ (a) danger (b) fun (c) food
B: 2. Who reconciled after Jacob took the blessings? _________
3. Who prevented a quarrel with his nephew Lot? _________
4. Who loved David as his own soul? _________
5. What did Jonathan and David make? _________
C: 1. What is the main idea of peaceful co-existence?
2. Name one person from the Bible who showed peaceful co-existence.
3. What is a moral responsibility mentioned regarding love?
5. What is one way pupils should show love to one another?
answers_B: Different people living together in peace
answers_C: Different people living together in peace without disagreement or fight.
Esau and Jacob (or Philemon and Onesimus, Isaac and Abimelech, Abraham and Lot)
To show unselfish love to others.
Share our belongings with others (or protect one another when there is danger, give help to the needy)
